text: 330ml can from Hay Deli, Hay on Way. A week out of date. Pours hazy pale yellow, big fluffy white head. Aroma is grassy lemon citrus. Taste follows. I imagine the hops used will have faded somewhat, it does taste like somethings lacking behind all that bitterness. Like Kenny says, it doesnt really taste like a pils but for it is its nice.

33cl can via Beer Gonzo. It pours a clean pale golden color with a medium creamy white head. Aroma is stunning fresh crispy grassy fruity hops with plenty notes of apricots, tangerine and freshly cut grass. Lightly tangy lemony and salty. Taste is also fresh and crisp, tangy with notes of lemon peel, tangerine, apricots, pine cones and light gooseberries. Light to medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, stunning session IPA
Can at home. Pours a hazy yellow colour. Very refreshing with a nice maltiness, some hop bite too. Delicious Pilsner.

Can. Archer Road Beer Stop, Sheffield. 2 quid! Opaque, straw colour. Rocky, frothy, thick, white head. Nose has beautifully clean, fresh, zingy hop. Notes of lemon peel. White grape. Nectarine. Some pilsner characteristics in there. Smells great. Taste is crisp, light bitter. Some dryness. Light body. Crisp and zesty. Some sweetness comes through on the finish, rounding things up nicely. Did this in about 2 minutes!

Can from Rehills of Jesmond. Pours a hazy straw colour with a nice lasting frothy white head. Nice hoppy aroma with grapefruit and citrus notes. The taste is more grapefruit. Crisp and refreshing. Perfect for a sunny day. Great lager.

4th May 2016Can. Hazy yellow gold beer, tidy white head. Palate is light, dry and fairly crisp. Light malts, mildly sweet. Semi sweet floralness. Nice lemony citrus. Very mild hop skunk. Finishes nibbly with a little sherbet. Nice beer, very nice but it dont taste like a Pils.

Can from Hops & Crafts Exeter,pours hazy pale straw in colour with a loose white head,aroma is inviting, pine, light grapefruit ,melon & some spicy notes ,the taste bittersweet ,melon ,light grapefruit with good dryness & some hop bitterness , smooth slightly oily & light bodied ,this is so drinkable ,fruity hop finish with more dryness & bitterness& spicy pepperiness . Good !

Can. Slightly hazy yellow colour, small white head. Aroma is floral, some spruce and mild sweet malty notes. Flavour is grassy, floral, fruity and some sweet malty notes. Refreshing and pleasant, but still has a nice bitter bite to it.

Aroma: light grain and cereal malts, lemon sorbet, lemon peel. Appearance: hazy, pale gold, small, creamy, white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: light citrus fruits, straw, grain and bread malts, quite bitter finish. Overall: actually a very nice Pilsner, nice citrus fruits in the aroma and palate. Pint at Colonna & Hunter, Bath.

Can in Devon, 23/04/16.
Hazy yellow with a decent off White swirl. 
Nose is juicy citric peel, light pine, dank hop notes, toasted grain, soft bread.
Taste comprises lemon rind, straw, grain, light cereal, tangerine, trace of mango, pine. 
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a dank hop spike.
Solid hoppy chugging jus.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Can from Cotteridge Wines; hazed yellow pour with a frothy white head, aroma has grapefruit, lemon, taste has bready malts, citrus, grapefruit, some spiced action, pleasantly crisp.

Can from Bottle Baron. Hazy pale golden body with a medium white head. No visible carbonation. Good lacing. Aroma of tonic water, grapefruit pith and a hint of custard. Flavour of steel and wet grass. Medium body with a smooth mouthfeel. Light fizz. Quite harsh and raw.

Can from Utobeer. It pours cloudy yellow - gold with a thick, foamy white head. The aroma is fresh, soft, creamy, cracker, grass, floral notes and bread. The taste is crisp, refreshingly bitter, some zesty lemon upfront, grapefruit, grass, white bread, cracker, white pepper and straw with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate, foamy carbonation. Fresh and very well balanced. Eminently crushable. Damn you Beavertown with your fucken awesome beer.

Can, pours hazy pale gold,small white foamy head. Aroma is hoppy, fresh and floral with sharp lemony citrus, over a grainy malt. Body is light, texture is mildly creamy, finish is crisp and dry with great balance between the well defined hops and malt. Carbonation is average. Hard to fault, very fresh.

First! Yay...! Pours hazy yellow with low white head. Aroma of pine, light citrus, some bread and malt. Taste is medium pine bitter with a mellow sweet finish. Light and smooth body with soft carbonation.
